intro.description: This cheat sheet helps you to open an image with fable imageviewer, and shows you how to use the intensity settings with the file. If you have just completed the previous cheat sheet, please close all your data file parts.

item.title: Data Browsing Perspective
item.description: Please choose the data browsing perspective if you do not already have it selected (nothing will happen if you do not).

item.title: Open File
item.description: Right click on an example file from the 'data' project containing a test image, then select 'Open With', then 'Fable Image'.

item.title: Select 'Autointensity' tool
item.description: Try clicking on the button labelled 'Scale the palette between the minimum and maximum intensity in the data' from the toolbar above the plot, to turn autointensity on and off. This button may be obscured on Linux if the window containing the plot is too small.

item.title: Turn off autointensity
item.description: Ensure that autointensity is turned off by clicking on the button labelled 'Scale the palette between the minimum and maximum intensity in the data' from the toolbar above the plot. When autointensity is of, the 'Current' intensity values (Min, Max) can be changed below the plot either by moving the slider, or typing in value. Set the Max Intensity to maximum by moving the slider to the right.

item.title: Turn on autointensity
item.description: Turn on autointensity by clicking on the button labelled 'Scale the palette between the minimum and maximum intensity in the data' from the toolbar above the plot. When autointensity is on, the 'Current' intensity values can not be changed below the plot. The Max Intensity is now automatically set to a lower value, instead of maximum value set in previous step.
